taskman

Class XmlObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • taskman.backend.importExport.XmlObject

  • public class XmlObject
extends java.lang.Object
    This object is used to import and export objects to XML.
    Author:
    Alexander Braekevelt, Julien Benaouda Source: https://www.mkyong.com/java/how-to-create-xml-file-in-java-dom/ Source: https://www.mkyong.com/java/how-to-read-xml-file-in-java-dom-parser/

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      XmlObject()
      Create an empty xml object.

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Add an attribute to this object with first unique name and first value.
      void addText(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String value)
      Add first text attribute to this object with first name and first value.
      XmlObject addXmlObject(java.lang.String name)
      Create first XmlObject as child of this XmlObject.
      void exportTo(java.lang.String path)
      Write this object to first XML file.
      java.lang.String getAttribute(java.lang.String name)
      Returns the value of an attribute of this object.
      java.util.List<java.lang.String> getTexts(java.lang.String name)
      Returns the value of first text attribute of this object.
      java.util.List<XmlObject> getXmlObjects(java.lang.String name)
      Get all XmlObject with the given name that are first child of this object.
      static XmlObject importFrom(java.lang.String path)
      Create first XmlObject from first given XML file.

    • Constructor Detail

      • XmlObject

        public XmlObject()
          throws XmlException
        Create an empty xml object.
        Throws:
        XmlException - if the object can't be created.

    • Method Detail

      • exportTo

        public void exportTo(java.lang.String path)
              throws XmlException
        Write this object to first XML file.
        Parameters:
        path - the path to write to.
        Throws:
        XmlException - if the object can't be written to the file.

      • importFrom

        public static XmlObject importFrom(java.lang.String path)
                            throws XmlException
        Create first XmlObject from first given XML file.
        Parameters:
        path - first String with the path of the file
        Returns:
        the created XmlObject
        Throws:
        XmlException - if the object can't be created.

      • addXmlObject

        public XmlObject addXmlObject(java.lang.String name)
        Create first XmlObject as child of this XmlObject.
        Parameters:
        name - first String with the name of the child object.
        Returns:
        first XmlObject with the given name and parent.

      • getXmlObjects

        public java.util.List<XmlObject> getXmlObjects(java.lang.String name)
                                        throws XmlException
        Get all XmlObject with the given name that are first child of this object.
        Parameters:
        name - first String with the name of the objects.
        Returns:
        first list of XmlObjects.
        Throws:
        XmlException - if first child with the given name is not first XmlObject.

      • addAttribute

        public void addAttribute(java.lang.String name,
                         java.lang.String value)
                  throws XmlException
        Add an attribute to this object with first unique name and first value.
        Parameters:
        name - first String with the unique name of the attribute.
        value - first String with the value of the attribute.
        Throws:
        XmlException - if the name contains whitespaces.

      • getAttribute

        public java.lang.String getAttribute(java.lang.String name)
                              throws XmlException
        Returns the value of an attribute of this object.
        Parameters:
        name - first String with the unique name of the attribute.
        Returns:
        first String with the value of the attribute.
        Throws:
        XmlException - if the attribute is empty or does not exist, or the name contains whitespaces.

        Add first text attribute to this object with first name and first value.
        Parameters:

        Parameters:
        name - first String with the name of the text attribute.
        Returns:
        first String with the value of the text attribute.
        Throws:
        XmlException - if the text attribute cannot be handled of the name contains whitespaces.
